entry.value: A gigantic bee, or maybe a wasp? The hero's movements are slowed down by her stings, so a large number of them could mean serious trouble. They're usually found near Hornets.

An armored rodent-insect hybrid. It's fast and poisonous. A single Chitin warrior should be easy to keep at a distance; a group, however, could easily corner and overwhelm the unsuspecting adventurer.
A smaller, weaker version of the Chitin warrior, this critter spits balls of acid out of sheer contempt for the player.
Cockroach - warrior. Armored, cunning, fast, master fencer - all this adds up to a formidable opponent. Don't even try to stomp on him.
It's a cow. What'd you expect? It'll probably try to eat, which is kind of unusual, but this is a bestiary after all.
Majestic, heavily armored insectoid. It might be a bit slow, but it's mass and resistance to damage make it an opponent to be reckoned with.
The mentally handicapped but explosively packed younger brother of the Crawler. He's fast, but weak and less armored - be sure to aim well.
Don't be fooled by his cudly appearance - this monster will happily bash your head in whenever he hears you. He'll destroy your mana reserves, too.
This is a monster? I don't think so. It heals the player, doesn't try to eat him... definitely not a monster. Then what's it doing in the bestiary, eh?
An extremely dangerous hornet-rodent hybrid. A flock of these would be really hard to beat, since they're quite speedy and resistant. What's more, their venom cripples and slows down the victim.
A dangerous opponnent in melee combat - her long legs cut the player deeply. It is advised to keep her at a distance with slowing or knocking back spells.
A smelly, cowardly beast. Attacks in groups, since that makes feel safe and strong. His heavy fists can bash and stun the opponnent.
A huge beast, as large (and strong) as a herd of bulls. Thankfully he isn't very smart, and only attacks in melee - but woe be to anyone caught in between his muscular arms.
A she-ogre adept at the magical arts is rare enough; but this particular beast specializes in frost magics, slowing down opponnents and piercing them with hundreds of small icicles.
This demon comes from the deepest and least explored reaches of hell. He commands powerful magic that summons multiple minions.
The strongest of ogre females bathe in the blood of their slayed victims, which should supposedly give them protection.
The ogrette, as the eastern magi call her, is a strong, loud, hateful monster full of spite and malice. Not exactly smart, though. Just keep your distance and you'll be fine.
The overgrown rat, or rather rats - it's rare to find only one of these - are weak, but many. Use area-of-effect spells to get rid of any pesky horde.
Similar to ye olde rat, this greenish-coloured vermin carries the plague. It's attacks are weaker, but they poison the victim.
This hairy fencer is a formidable threat. His two favorite weapons - the sword and the mace - allow him to stun and slice battle mages (his preffered snack) with speed and ease.
This timberman tries to chop the player to pieces, since the development team didn't code NPCs into the game. Maybe one day he'll be able to give us a quest?
This self-proclaimed guardian of the forest is frothing-mad with the urge to kill.
This is what happens when you disturb someone while they're making breakfast - they run around trying to stab you in the eye with a bread knife. What a world.
This large, hard-skinned swamp-dweller is recognised for his strength and quick regeneration. When facing a group, best take them out one at a time.
The black mantle is a giveaway - this battlemage went over to the wrong side of the force, and now flails bolts of dark energy at his former colleagues. Probably too much mercury fumes.
Half-man, half-wolf, all-hungry. Fast, strong, likes to pray on the weak.
An old rat, guardian of the arcane passage. Very weak due to his age.
Toxic flying carrot, comes in batches.
It may be slow, but it's often surrounded by minions and uses a deadly piercing laser attack.
